IMDb data; ttnr: 5311542, Title: Werk ohne Autor, --- Description: Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGE2ZmVhOGUtOWE4Ni00MDZiLWJkMTktOWI5ZWU0ZDk1NGViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"chong_an","dateCreated":"2018-09-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What is truth in art?","reviewBody":"Inspired by the life of one artist and stories by others, this tale of fiction asks artists what is their truth, and how they are able to reveal it. Along the way, it shows how Nazi and Soviet art have strong similarities in their realisms, while modern art can be conceptual jokes.

The humans are 2 families who, if they knew, were on opposite sides during the Nazi era. The artist / husband's father suffered both ways as joining the Nazis too late, while his beloved aunt was sent away by his father-in-law, eventually to the gas chambers. But the father-in-law spends his post-war life in fear of Nazi hunters, even as he hides in plain sight.

Featuring a strong cast and realistic sets, this is a strong movie. Still, from the director's Q+A from the Toronto International Film Festival, the idea of subjective truth that also infuses the film can be a distraction.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse
programme.desc:
Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse: Directed by Christopher Landon. With Tye Sheridan, Logan Miller, Joey Morgan, Sarah Dumont. Three scouts, on the eve of their last camp-out, discover the true meaning of friendship when they attempt to save their town from a zombie outbreak." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1727776/","name":"Scouts Guide to the Zombie Apocalypse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NjczNjE4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODk0MjQ5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three scouts, on the eve of their last camp-out, discover the true meaning of friendship when they attempt to save their town from a zombie outbreak.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1727776/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"issachar"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly Good","reviewBody":"With no expectation at all for this film. Turned out it's so much better that just another silly class B zombie clone.

And it's not just particular part, but for overall writing, directing, shooting, lighting, acting, music, etc. 

The opening gives me the tense and the acting of Janitor (Blake Anderson) is really great. Other male casts are alright, but could be better. I know they need to look "scouts" but come on, these are the guys saving the world :)

The acting of Sarah Dumont is so cool and tough, very nice. And I wish to see more Halston Sage (who wouldn't?) :p

Highly recommended if you haven't watch it yet.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49220,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2015-10-30","keywords":"zombie,boy scout,hardware store,friendship between boys,blonde","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2060038937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMTc0NzM3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE1NzI2NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQxMTc0NzM3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDE1NzI2NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the eve of their last camp-out, three scouts discover the true meaning of friendship when they attempt to save their town from a zombie outbreak."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4446467/","name":"Tye Sheridan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2383250/","name":"Logan Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6368720/","name":"Joey Morgan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484907/","name":"Christopher Landon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163543/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284585/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933144/","name":"Carrie Lee Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0595088/","name":"Emi Mochizuki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484907/","name":"Christopher Landon"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Roosterbooster"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tribute to human courage.","reviewBody":"Zulu is the true story of the battle of Rourke's Drift between the British and Zulu nations in 1879. Both nations were aggressive, expansionist peoples. The British had pursued trade throughout the 18th and 19th centuries and suddenly found themselves in possession of an empire encompassing one quarter of the world. The Zulus, under the warrior-king Shaka Zulu, had become a society totally devoted to warfare and, with the possible exception of the Spartans over two thousand years before them, the most fearless soldiers the world had ever seen. It is important not to succumb to political correctness here, the Zulus had ruthlessly oppressed other nations in black Africa and caused mass migrations of people, the effects of which are felt to this day. The British meanwhile, had provoked a confrontation with them and suffered a defeat at Isandlwana where modern weapons has proved insufficient against overwhelming numbers of incredibly brave and disciplined warriors. The day after the battle the small British garrison at Rourke's Drift seemed doomed. Just over 100 men plus sick men in the hospital faced thousands of Zulus eager for their share of the glory which their brothers had won at Isandlwana.

The nature of the British Army at this time was not promising. Before Waterloo in 1815 the Duke of Wellington had described them as "the scum of the earth" - rogues, ne'er-do-wells, criminals, drunkards, ladanum fiends, debtors fresh from prison, even lunatics. In 1879 they were not much different. They were incredibly badly paid, their conditions of service were atrocious, they were despised by the civilians, led by officers who often owed their position to aristocratic privilege and money. Sometimes they were booed in the street and refused access to pubs and music halls such was their lowly status. And yet, and yet... they had faced and defeated some of the most fearsome warriors on Earth. The Pathans, Burmese, Afghans, Sudanese "Fuzzy-Wuzzies" as well as Napoleon's invincible Imperial Guard. If they survived the bloody colonial wars they could expect an early death in the work-house, unappreciated by the people whose incomes they had guarded. If you are interested in the Victorian soldiers see Kipling's poems (especially "Tommy Atkins") or read George Orwell's long essay on Kipling or "The Lion And The Unicorn".

This film salutes human beings in extremis. Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"duration":"PT2H18M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Madame Bovary
Pani Bovary
Madame Bovary
programme.desc:
Madame Bovary: Directed by Claude Chabrol. With Isabelle Huppert, Jean-François Balmer, Christophe Malavoy, Jean Yanne. In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102368/","name":"Madame Bovary","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDY3YjIyMDItMWNlMS00ZDIzLWJhMDUtN2NlOTNjMmI3MGUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzUyOTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In nineteenth-century France, the romantic daughter of a country squire marries a dull country doctor. To escape boredom, she throws herself into love affairs with a suave local landowner and a law student, and runs up ruinous debts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102368/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2007-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"the film Flaubert would have made from his novel","reviewBody":"This was Claude Chabrol's intention and it's easier to say than to do. Gustave Flaubert's novel was so rich, undulating that any adaptation in images can only be reducing and simplistic. More than the tragic story of its heroine, Flaubert's novel encompassed a word picture of Normandy (the bulk of the film was shot in the village of Lyons-La-Forêt near Rouen) and a cruel, cynical vision of the world. If the first feature is satisfying on the screen, the second one is hardly perceptible. Hence, this crucial question: is it possible to fully recreate Flaubert's novel? Chabrol's film is faithful to the main plot with the rise and fall of her heroine sometimes told by François Périer's voice-over in spite of accelerated views on certain vital episodes, notably the peasant marriage that disgusted Emma Bovary. On the other hand, the crest of the novel (the ball to the marquis) found a perfect equivalent in Chabrol's film with this shot which goes through the turning dresses creating thus a whirlpool. The glittering life Emma dreams of instead of a dull one with her mediocre husband Charles.

Chabrol is buoyed by topnotch interpretations. Even if Isabelle Huppert is a convincing Emma Bovary, a woman whose messy dreams and follies badly conceal boredom and disgust of her condition, the other main actors steal the show with Jean-François Balmer as the perfect, narrow-minded Charles Bovary, Christophe Malavoy as unfaithful Rodolphe Boulanger and Jean Yanne as the unscrupulous chemist Homais.

"Madame Bovary" is aesthetically a refined work with lush scenery and lavish costumes that recreate rural life in Normandy in the middle of the nineteenth Century. But Chabrol doesn't break new ground with this adaptation that required something else than an elegant directing, a brilliant cast and splendid scenery. That's why his rendering of Flaubert's work is just an honorable reading of the novel in the end. One could also add that Flaubert's book was a solid opportunity for an onslaught at provincial lower middle class. But it's only skimmed over and it's a wasted bonanza.

Chabrol's reading of "Madame Bovary" amounts to the same result as Claude Berri's adaptation of Emile Zola's epic novel "Germinal" in 1993: honorable instead of being unforgettable, a commendable action instead of a ground-breaking creation. The author of "le Boucher" (1970) was rather on the wrong track but fortunately, he'll find his way again the following year with another woman depiction: "Betty" (1992). Georges Simenon's universe suits him much better than Flaubert's one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3885,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1991-04-03","keywords":"character name as title,emma bovary character,period drama,quoting alphonse de lamartine,wedding","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Madame Bovary (1991)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3198616345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmY4NDQ3ZjItNDY2OC00NWM5LTg4ZDMtZDczNmIxNWJlZTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Samuel Goldwyn"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050983/","name":"Jean-François Balmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539022/","name":"Christophe Malavoy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022545/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254873/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281306/","name":"Gustave Flaubert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001031/","name":"Claude Chabrol"}],"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Werk ohne Autor
Obrazy bez autora
Werk ohne Autor
programme.desc:
Werk ohne Autor: Directed by Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck. With Tom Schilling, Sebastian Koch, Paula Beer, Saskia Rosendahl. German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5311542/","name":"Werk ohne Autor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGE2ZmVhOGUtOWE4Ni00MDZiLWJkMTktOWI5ZWU0ZDk1NGViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5311542/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chong_an"},"dateCreated":"2018-09-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"What is truth in art?","reviewBody":"Inspired by the life of one artist and stories by others, this tale of fiction asks artists what is their truth, and how they are able to reveal it. Along the way, it shows how Nazi and Soviet art have strong similarities in their realisms, while modern art can be conceptual jokes.

The humans are 2 families who, if they knew, were on opposite sides during the Nazi era. The artist / husband's father suffered both ways as joining the Nazis too late, while his beloved aunt was sent away by his father-in-law, eventually to the gas chambers. But the father-in-law spends his post-war life in fear of Nazi hunters, even as he hides in plain sight.

Featuring a strong cast and realistic sets, this is a strong movie. Still, from the director's Q+A from the Toronto International Film Festival, the idea of subjective truth that also infuses the film can be a distraction.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-10-03","keywords":"east germany,painter,doctor,forced abortion,pregnancy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1224587801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMThhNzU3YTktOTgwZS00OTY0LTgwNDctYmI1YWIyYTA1YjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"'Never Look Away' follows thirty years in the life of artist Kurt Barnert (a character loosely based on Gerhard Richter). From a childhood witnessing Nazi Germany to life in post-war East Berlin."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462407/","name":"Sebastian Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3559009/","name":"Paula Beer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0569143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0128215/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003697/","name":"Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck"}],"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Shiva Baby
Shiva Baby
programme.desc: Shiva Baby: Directed by Emma Seligman. With Rachel Sennott, Danny Deferrari, Fred Melamed, Polly Draper. At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11317142/","name":"Shiva Baby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Y5ZDg1MmMtNjJkYS00NmEzLTk0ZjAtMGUxOTIyMDVlNzM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11317142/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pjtaylor-96-138044"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The chaos of cringe.","reviewBody":"Set mostly in real time, 'Shiva Baby (2020)' focuses on a young woman whose life seems to spiral out of control when she bumps into her sugar daddy at a shiva. It's basically an exercise in controlled chaos. With its claustrophobic atmosphere, creepy soundtrack and uncomfortably relatable cringe, the picture basically feels like a panic attack on screen. In many ways, it actually tells its tales using tropes of the horror genre. It swaps jump-scares for awkward confrontations, monsters for judgmental relatives and blood and guts for unattainable expectations. It's not scary, as such, but it certainly gets under your skin, eking as much suspense from its central situation as possible. It puts you in the position of its protagonist, bombarded with passive aggressive prying and close calls with the truth. There's almost always an impending sense of doom; devastation seems inevitable. The flick isn't dour, though. It's often quietly funny, its comedy coming purely from its characters and their almost unbearable social situation. There's quite a bit of dramatic irony going on and it works very well. As does the character development in general, which is slight but significant. Every player feels like an actual person, like someone you could (and probably do) actually know, and that's really impressive. Overall, this is an entertaining and engaging film. It's interesting, well-written and unique. 7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14207,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-04-02","keywords":"sugar daddy,jewish family,jewish,jewish culture,cheating husband","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3846750489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA5OWQwNTgtZmRlYS00ZjRhLWIyM2YtYmMwOWI5NTM2MDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA5OWQwNTgtZmRlYS00ZjRhLWIyM2YtYmMwOWI5NTM2MDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman struggles to keep up different versions of herself when she runs into her sugar daddy and her ex-girlfriend at a shiva with her parents."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6976735/","name":"Rachel Sennott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1876851/","name":"Danny Deferrari"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577329/","name":"Fred Melamed"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7681231/","name":"Emma Seligman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0887628/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483204/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0887627/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7681231/","name":"Emma Seligman"}],"duration":"PT1H17M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 11317142, Title: Shiva Baby, --- Description: Shiva Baby: Directed by Emma Seligman. With Rachel Sennott, Danny Deferrari, Fred Melamed, Polly Draper. At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11317142/","name":"Shiva Baby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Y5ZDg1MmMtNjJkYS00NmEzLTk0ZjAtMGUxOTIyMDVlNzM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY1MTg4Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11317142/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Pjtaylor-96-138044","dateCreated":"2021-06-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The chaos of cringe.","reviewBody":"Set mostly in real time, 'Shiva Baby (2020)' focuses on a young woman whose life seems to spiral out of control when she bumps into her sugar daddy at a shiva. It's basically an exercise in controlled chaos. With its claustrophobic atmosphere, creepy soundtrack and uncomfortably relatable cringe, the picture basically feels like a panic attack on screen. In many ways, it actually tells its tales using tropes of the horror genre. It swaps jump-scares for awkward confrontations, monsters for judgmental relatives and blood and guts for unattainable expectations. It's not scary, as such, but it certainly gets under your skin, eking as much suspense from its central situation as possible. It puts you in the position of its protagonist, bombarded with passive aggressive prying and close calls with the truth. There's almost always an impending sense of doom; devastation seems inevitable. The flick isn't dour, though. It's often quietly funny, its comedy coming purely from its characters and their almost unbearable social situation. There's quite a bit of dramatic irony going on and it works very well. As does the character development in general, which is slight but significant. Every player feels like an actual person, like someone you could (and probably do) actually know, and that's really impressive. Overall, this is an entertaining and engaging film. It's interesting, well-written and unique. 7/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14207,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-04-02","keywords":"sugar daddy,jewish family,jewish,jewish culture,cheating husband","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3846750489","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA5OWQwNTgtZmRlYS00ZjRhLWIyM2YtYmMwOWI5NTM2MDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA5OWQwNTgtZmRlYS00ZjRhLWIyM2YtYmMwOWI5NTM2MDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman struggles to keep up different versions of herself when she runs into her sugar daddy and her ex-girlfriend at a shiva with her parents.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6976735/","name":"Rachel Sennott","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1876851/","name":"Danny Deferrari","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577329/","name":"Fred Melamed"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7681231/","name":"Emma Seligman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0887628/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483204/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0887627/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7681231/","name":"Emma Seligman"],"duration":"PT1H17M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Roosterbooster"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tribute to human courage.","reviewBody":"Zulu is the true story of the battle of Rourke's Drift between the British and Zulu nations in 1879. Both nations were aggressive, expansionist peoples. The British had pursued trade throughout the 18th and 19th centuries and suddenly found themselves in possession of an empire encompassing one quarter of the world. The Zulus, under the warrior-king Shaka Zulu, had become a society totally devoted to warfare and, with the possible exception of the Spartans over two thousand years before them, the most fearless soldiers the world had ever seen. It is important not to succumb to political correctness here, the Zulus had ruthlessly oppressed other nations in black Africa and caused mass migrations of people, the effects of which are felt to this day. The British meanwhile, had provoked a confrontation with them and suffered a defeat at Isandlwana where modern weapons has proved insufficient against overwhelming numbers of incredibly brave and disciplined warriors. The day after the battle the small British garrison at Rourke's Drift seemed doomed. Just over 100 men plus sick men in the hospital faced thousands of Zulus eager for their share of the glory which their brothers had won at Isandlwana.

The nature of the British Army at this time was not promising. Before Waterloo in 1815 the Duke of Wellington had described them as "the scum of the earth" - rogues, ne'er-do-wells, criminals, drunkards, ladanum fiends, debtors fresh from prison, even lunatics. In 1879 they were not much different. They were incredibly badly paid, their conditions of service were atrocious, they were despised by the civilians, led by officers who often owed their position to aristocratic privilege and money. Sometimes they were booed in the street and refused access to pubs and music halls such was their lowly status. And yet, and yet... they had faced and defeated some of the most fearsome warriors on Earth. The Pathans, Burmese, Afghans, Sudanese "Fuzzy-Wuzzies" as well as Napoleon's invincible Imperial Guard. If they survived the bloody colonial wars they could expect an early death in the work-house, unappreciated by the people whose incomes they had guarded. If you are interested in the Victorian soldiers see Kipling's poems (especially "Tommy Atkins") or read George Orwell's long essay on Kipling or "The Lion And The Unicorn".

This film salutes human beings in extremis. Though told from the British viewpoint it pays handsome tribute to the magnificent courage and honour of the Zulu warriors as well as the British soldiers wondering "what are we doing here?". The best perfomances in the film, in my opinion, are from James Booth as Private Hook, the cynical drunkard turned reluctant hero and Nigel Green as the awesome Colour-Sergeant Bourne. It portrays courage and stoicism which modern people seem to lack; heroism when all seems lost, faith in the regiment and your mates and old-fashioned manliness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38166,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

Titanic.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"beaumisebastian"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"James Cameron's Titanic is a masterpiece and a tour de force of filmmaking","reviewBody":"Titanic is world famous. The film that broke every box office record on release and wore the box office champion crown for many years(until it was overtaken by Jim Cameron's Avatar) is special because not only does it showcase the Titanic disaster in all its glory the film is a technical achievement of the highest order. The sinking sequence is astonishing and it feels like you are watching the actual ship sink. The characters and actors are amazing and even with a large running length you never dare look at the watch. James Cameron is a master director and Titanic is his stamp of authority."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1109625,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"keywords":"iceberg,sailor's death,love affair,sunken ship,mass death","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"3D Release","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi907189785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzczNjA2MTY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTgyNDY2NzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzczNjA2MTY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTgyNDY2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the new trailer for James Cameron's Academy Award winning blockbuster, coming to theaters in 3D. programme.title: Justine
programme.desc: Justine dąży do autodestrukcji. Jej przyjaciółka Peach zmaga się z podobnymi problemami. Świadome braku perspektyw, razem uciekają od problemów w alkohol. Pewnego razu Justine spotyka studentkę Rachel. Dzięki niej zyskuje nadzieję na normalne życie. Wkrótce jednak zaczyna dziać się coś, co obraca te marzenia wniwecz.

programme.title: The Good Liar
Kłamstwo doskonałe
The Good Liar
programme.desc:
The Good Liar: Directed by Bill Condon. With Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen, Russell Tovey, Jim Carter. Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate stakes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5563334/","name":"The Good Liar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhNTY5ZTUtYzc1NC00NjUyLWI1NDQtYWE3YmJlNjQ3OGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate st","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5563334/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tm-sheehan"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Masterclass in Great Acting","reviewBody":"My Review : The Good Liar my rating 8.5

No Spoilers as usual from me except to say the trailers of The Good Liar give us only an inkling into the complex maze the plot reveals and that it's a master class in great acting from Sir Ian McKellen and Dame Helen Mirren.

I think it's the finest performance from Ian McKellen since his Oscar nominated role in Gods and Monsters in 1999 and I'm not surprised that Bill Condon the director of this film also directed Ian McKellen in Gods and Monsters.

In The Good Liar Ian McKellen is cast as Roy Courtnay who meets Helen Mirren cast as Betty McLeish on a mature age dating site it soon becomes apparently clear that Roy's motives are not honourable in any way shape or form it takes us a lot longer to reveal Betty's true motive. In the meantime we meet Betty's hunky handsome protective Grandson Stephen perfectly played by Russell Tovey who seeks out to find out all he can about his Grandmother's new border and boyfriend.

Jim Carter who plays Mr Carson in Downton Abbey is very impressive in the very different role of Vincent the best friend of Roy Courtney and "business associate " it's a great ensemble cast and this film has some great plot twisters and surprises that at times may seem a little improbable but that didn't bother me a bit.

It's the performances of McKellen and Mirren that are sublime, subtle and mesmerising the range of these two actors is astonishing when you think back to characters like Helen Mirren in The Queen or Catherine the Great and Maria Altman in Woman in Gold then Ian McKellen as Gandalf or James Whale in Gods and Monsters and King Lear to see them together in a film for the first time ,they have appeared on stage together in 2001 in Dance of Death on Broadway.

I must mention the great score by Carter Burwell it's perfect and gives great atmosphere to the emotional and suspenseful plot I really like his scores and this is up with his previous film scores for Carol, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing ,Missouri and In Bruges.

I really enjoyed The Good Liar go see it and don't let anyone tell you the outcome of this complex story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36833,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-11-08","keywords":"con artist,elderly gigolo,past coming back to haunt,online dating,flashback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1183235865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005212/","name":"Ian McKellen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869871/","name":"Russell Tovey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8006852/","name":"Nicholas Searle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368774/","name":"Jeffrey Hatcher"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Minyan
Minjan
Minyan
programme.desc:
Minyan: Directed by Eric Steel. With Samuel H. Levine, Ron Rifkin, Christopher McCann, Mark Margolis. A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10268550/","name":"Minyan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA3NGFhMGMtNzYzYy00NTM5LTkzMWMtMmUyMDZlNTdlMGVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMyMzI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10268550/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ten men are needed for a minyan","reviewBody":"Minyan (2020) was co-written and directed by Eric Steel. It stars Samuel H. Levine as David, a young yeshiva student, who has to come to grips with the fact that he is gay, and the fact that he is not certain that he believes in God.

Sadly, coming out as gay in a traditional family is a problem for many people. The centrality of this problem is reflected in the number of movies about gays coming out. What makes this movie different is the superb acting, and the uncanny rendering of Orthodox Jewish life in Brooklyn in the 1980's.

A minyan is ten men (or ten people) that are required for a full Jewish prayer service. As do people in other religions, Jews pray all the time. But it requires a minyan to bring out the Torah. Part of the plot depends upon the fact that David and his father can make a minyan where they live.

We saw this film as part of Image Out, the excellent Rochester LGBT Film Festival. This isn't a great movie, but I think it's worth seeing. The film has an anemic IMDb rating of 6.7. I thought it was better than that and rated it 8.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-10-29","keywords":"male nudity,male rear nudity,gay sex,gay interest,jewish","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3601580825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRkODkxODItNDU3MC00MzgxLWEwOWEtYjI3ZDU1ZjJkOTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRkODkxODItNDU3MC00MzgxLWEwOWEtYjI3ZDU1ZjJkOTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Jewish man is caught between thrilling private trysts and his repressive family in this thoughtful drama set in 1980s Brooklyn."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6024011/","name":"Samuel H. programme.title: Pilátus
Piłat
Pilátus
programme.desc: Pilátus: Directed by Linda Dombrovszky. With Ildikó Hámori, Anna Györgyi, Zsolt Kovács, Sándor Terhes. The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10398080/","name":"Pilátus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZmMWIyZGYtZDZlZS00YWVkLTlhZjMtNGE4YjM4OWYxZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM3NzY3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10398080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"b_velkova"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A very polite attempt on a primal topic","reviewBody":"The dynamics is very real, but the tone is too formal, even for a doctor's family. Coldness is one thing, but you can't get that distant, no matter the level of dysfunctionality. I remember calling my mother by her last name when I was a teenager, but I never went to her room with the newspaper and asked: "What type of news would you like to hear, mother?" Also, the story is a bit one-sided and doesn't go very deep: behind such clashes usually there are reasons bigger than the mere generational conflict, or a "misunderstood love" as it goes in the description. All in all, a very polite attempt on a primal topic, but for what it is, it's very well executed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-01-29","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405418/","name":"Ildikó Hámori"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350587/","name":"Anna Györgyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468514/","name":"Zsolt Kovács"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2843398/","name":"Linda Dombrovszky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747074/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4302531/","name":"György Somogyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0843651/","name":"Magda Szabó"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2703215/","name":"Sándor Szélesi"}]}</script><metacontent="

The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10398080/","name":"Pilátus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZmMWIyZGYtZDZlZS00YWVkLTlhZjMtNGE4YjM4OWYxZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM3NzY3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10398080/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"b_velkova","dateCreated":"2020-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A very polite attempt on a primal topic","reviewBody":"The dynamics is very real, but the tone is too formal, even for a doctor's family. Coldness is one thing, but you can't get that distant, no matter the level of dysfunctionality. I remember calling my mother by her last name when I was a teenager, but I never went to her room with the newspaper and asked: "What type of news would you like to hear, mother?" Also, the story is a bit one-sided and doesn't go very deep: behind such clashes usually there are reasons bigger than the mere generational conflict, or a "misunderstood love" as it goes in the description. All in all, a very polite attempt on a primal topic, but for what it is, it's very well executed.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-01-29","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405418/","name":"Ildikó Hámori","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350587/","name":"Anna Györgyi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468514/","name":"Zsolt Kovács"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2843398/","name":"Linda Dombrovszky"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747074/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4302531/","name":"György Somogyi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0843651/","name":"Magda Szabó","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2703215/","name":"Sándor Szélesi"]</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Yo, imposible
Ja nieistniejące
Yo, Imposible
programme.desc: Yo, imposible: Directed by Patricia Ortega. With Lucía Bedoya, Belkis Avilladares, María Elena Duque, Adyane Gonzalez. A young woman discovers she was submitted to several surgeries to correct her intersexual body as a baby. She has to find her own self outside gender binaries." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9321408/","name":"Yo, imposible","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDcxY2IxZWItNTY5MC00MDFkLWExOWItYjczMWE5NGQyOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTg1MDMwMjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman discovers she was submitted to several surgeries to correct her intersexual body as a baby. She has to find her own self outside gender binaries.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9321408/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"patrickfilbeck"},"dateCreated":"2021-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A film resting on its subject","reviewBody":"Apparently it is not possible to write a lasting (negative) review of this film without moral guards approving it for deletion. How come? Because this is about the issue of a "deviant" sexual identity? Like with "The Danish Girl"? A film that I liked very much because it had cinematic and storytelling qualities and wasn't completely resting on a topic that was just hyped? I'll say it again: I don't care about people's sexuality as long as it is not overbearing or attacking or endangering other people. When I watch a film or a work of art about it, I first look at the topic neutrally. This film didn't manage to give me a feeling that made it cinematic. Inflationary dramaturgy, the already mentioned resting on a trendy topic, boring cinematography, mediocre to poor acting performances etc. Left me disappointed with this film. But hey, it seems hard to express an opinion like that, right? Because the current misunderstanders of morality, ethics and justice obviously cannot deal with opinions on works of art, because they believe that it is useful to play the arrogant and uninformed moral police on every bad product that affects one of their beloved trend topics. Unfortunately, democracy will probably not work with such people in the long term.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":147,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-20","keywords":"title directed by female,f rated,triple f rated,female protagonist,no opening credits","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10275870/","name":"Lucía Bedoya"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10275871/","name":"Belkis Avilladares"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5913510/","name":"María Elena Duque"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1952204/","name":"Patricia Ortega"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0260424/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0722760/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2989037/","name":"Enmanuel Chávez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1952204/","name":"Patricia Ortega"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Away
Odległa kraina
Projām
programme.desc: Away: Directed by Gints Zilbalodis. A boy and a little bird are on a journey across a strange island trying to get back home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8288450/","name":"Away","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWE1ZTBhYWYtNmZkYy00MGZjLTgzMmYtYTYyMzg5M2VkOTQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzYzNjgzNDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy and a little bird are on a journey across a strange island trying to get back home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8288450/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"No dialogue, no problem though...","reviewBody":"A young boy comes to, hanging by his parachute from a tree. When a large dark creature approaches him, he senses this is no ally and manages to escape to begin a curious journey through this strange land trying to get home. His journey is told in episode form, each offering us an engaging instalment of his adventures during which he encounters and befriends a small, yellow, bird and finds a motor bike on which they try to stay one step ahead of their lumbering, pursuing, nemesis. The storyline is intriguing, there is a gentle sense of menace from the pursuing "monster" - perhaps it is death - and the animation is clear and colourful. I have to say, I disliked the score - way too much, repetitive and frequently distracting from an otherwise charming little story of determination and companionship. Well worth watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1190,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Animation","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-11-15","keywords":"boy","director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6478535/","name":"Gints Zilbalodis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0628073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6478535/","name":"Gints Zilbalodis"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

His journey is told in episode form, each offering us an engaging instalment of his adventures during which he encounters and befriends a small, yellow, bird and finds a motor bike on which they try to stay one step ahead of their lumbering, pursuing, nemesis. The storyline is intriguing, there is a gentle sense of menace from the pursuing "monster" - perhaps it is death - and the animation is clear and colourful. programme.title: O que arde

O que arde
programme.desc: O que arde: Directed by Oliver Laxe. With Amador Arias, Benedicta Sánchez, Inazio Abrao, Elena Mar Fernández. Amador returns home to his aging mother after serving a sentence for arson. He tries to adapt to daily farm life and coping with the villagers' memories of his past actions.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8212958/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hof-4"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The truth 24 times a second","reviewBody":"The title O Que Arde means "what burns," which has been translated as "The Fire will Come" with some change of meaning. Yes, there is a plot but it could be told in a couple of lines and is not important after all. What we watch in this movie is life in a small town in Galicia, in the northwest corner of Spain. The language is mostly Galician with a few Spanish interpolations. Actors are local people, play themselves with their own names and go about their everyday chores apparently oblivious to the camera. The are glimpses of Galicia's reality such as migration of young people to the cities, excessive logging of forests, dedicated firemen with woefully few resources, a villager trying to improve a ruined dwelling into a casa rural (rural house) fit for prospective tourists. The climate is mild and rainy but the summers are dry, facilitating forest fires that are sometimes the result of arson. Both the melancholic winter landscapes and the summer fires are strikingly put on screen.\n\nDirector and scriptwriter Oliver Laxe, scriptwriter Santiago Fillol and cinematographer Mauro Herce have joined forces to produce a masterpiece where the boundary between living and acting is blurry and where we find ourselves in the middle of the action for the duration of the movie. programme.title: Awaken
Obudź się
Awaken
programme.desc:
Awaken: Directed by Tom Löwe. With Annatina Albin, John Alvarez, Agnes Anderson, Ashaka. Executive produced by cinema pioneers Terrence Malick and Godfrey Reggio, AWAKEN is a celebration of the spirit of life, an exploration of the Earth, and an ode to the Cosmos." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7128316/","name":"Awaken","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjdmYjJjZGItYjlhNS00Y2Y3LTg5MzUtYWMyNGY1MjU3ODQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM0NTU5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Executive produced by cinema pioneers Terrence Malick and Godfrey Reggio, AWAKEN is a celebration of the spirit of life, an exploration of the Earth, and an ode to the Cosmos.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7128316/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wargentin"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not at the level of the classics in this genre","reviewBody":"This does contain a substantial amount of incredibly beautifully shot time-lapse footage and that is clearly the strongest aspect of the production. Unfortunately it does also feel derivative and superficial, at times even fake compared to some of the classics in this genre like Koyaanisqatsi and Baraka that it is clearly influenced by. It feels a bit like it is half way between those and Ashes and Snow to me. The parts portraying European cultures are clearly just role-play taking us at least a hundred years back.

One can't help but notice the almost total absence of older and the strong focus on young women. Life on earth ends up being portrayed as more of an endless party instead of the social commentary you get in something like Le Syndrome du Titanic or the spiritual-naturistic message of Samsara that you see the remnants of in the way which this imitates Fricke's works. On the audio side the soundtrack is not bad but not at the level of Philip Glass or Michael Stearns while (thankfully very limited) narration offered by Liv Tyler is even more out of place here than in Terence Malick's Voyage of Time. The sound effects should have been left out.

Overall I still enjoyed the beauty of it and I always love seeing new entries in this genre. My review's tone probably seems really harsh considering that but that is just due to the standard set by Ron Fricke and others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":199,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2021-04-09","keywords":"timelapse,nature,world,very little dialogue,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2022359065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjZhODMwNGUtM2QyNy00ZDEzLTkxMjEtYTBiZWEyODIxNWE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjZhODMwNGUtM2QyNy00ZDEzLTkxMjEtYTBiZWEyODIxNWE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12323105/","name":"Annatina Albin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12323099/","name":"John Alvarez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026037/","name":"Agnes Anderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2233588/","name":"Tom Löwe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0714752/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0365534/"}],"duration":"PT1H14M"}</script><metacontent="

Unfortunately it does also feel derivative and superficial, at times even fake compared to some of the classics in this genre like Koyaanisqatsi and Baraka that it is clearly influenced by. It feels a bit like it is half way between those and Ashes and Snow to me. The parts portraying European cultures are clearly just role-play taking us at least a hundred years back.

Overall I still enjoyed the beauty of it and I always love seeing new entries in this genre. My review's tone probably seems really harsh considering that but that is just due to the standard set by Ron Fricke and others.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":199,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2021-04-09","keywords":"timelapse,nature,world,very little dialogue,one word title","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2022359065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjZhODMwNGUtM2QyNy00ZDEzLTkxMjEtYTBiZWEyODIxNWE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjZhODMwNGUtM2QyNy00ZDEzLTkxMjEtYTBiZWEyODIxNWE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12323105/","name":"Annatina Albin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12323099/","name":"John Alvarez","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026037/","name":"Agnes Anderson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2233588/","name":"Tom Löwe"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0714752/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0588435/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0365534/"],"duration":"PT1H14M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Long Day's Dying
Kres długiego dnia
The Long Day's Dying
programme.desc:
The Long Day's Dying: Directed by Peter Collinson. With David Hemmings, Tony Beckley, Tom Bell, Alan Dobie. The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0063237/","name":"The Long Day's Dying","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyMzM4ZGUtMmI2NC00OTA5LTljNjQtMzNiODQwM2E2ZTcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0063237/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wuxmup"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grim. Needs to be on DVD","reviewBody":"It's hard for me to assign the "fair" number of stars to this film, but I settled on 8 because of its high production values and what was, in 1968, an innovative approach to the war film. Remember too that I haven't seen it since 1969. But it did make a strong impression.

The Long Day's Dying must be one of the most vivid antiwar films ever made. It achieves this simply by portraying in extremely realistic terms the actions of a handful of soldiers in Northwestern Europe in 1944-45. No film before this one showed war at the infantry squad level with so much brutal detail, and all in a coldly dispassionate way that lets the actions speak for themselves. There is no preaching, no sentimentality, no comic relief, no complicated scenarios.

Unfortunately, there's no subtlety either. Partly because of their situation - trying to stay alive - the characters come across as flat, familiar cliché's. As "entertainment," the film doesn't make it, though it was clearly not intended to "entertain." It was intended to slug you over the head with the misery and horror of World War II and modern war in general. This was twenty years before Platoon and thirty before Saving Private Ryan, both of which are far more "watchable" films. Here the flat and generally disagreeable characters, the lack of an actual plot, and the realistically unpleasant images (including what may be the first on-screen vomit in theatrical history) make the film hard to sit through, though it is only 95 minutes.

So, 10 stars for production and realism, 4 stars for the feeling you'll have when it's over, a bonus star for having its heart in the right place. Average: 8.

Like Carl Foreman's underrated "The Victors," an equally downbeat but more interesting and thought-provoking film, The Long Day's Dying seems not to be on DVD. Why not? Both films have been on cable a number of times.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":481,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1968-05-28","keywords":"shot to death,no survivors,farmhouse,corpse,cult film","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0376101/","name":"David Hemmings"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065777/","name":"Tony Beckley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068552/","name":"Tom Bell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0172772/","name":"Peter Collinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010407/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0924430/","name":"Alan White"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0939606/","name":"Charles Wood"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0063237, Title: The Long Day's Dying, --- Description: The Long Day's Dying: Directed by Peter Collinson. With David Hemmings, Tony Beckley, Tom Bell, Alan Dobie. The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0063237/","name":"The Long Day's Dying","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyMzM4ZGUtMmI2NC00OTA5LTljNjQtMzNiODQwM2E2ZTcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The saga of three British soldiers and their German captive as they trek through the European countryside.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0063237/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"wuxmup","dateCreated":"2006-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grim. Needs to be on DVD","reviewBody":"It's hard for me to assign the "fair" number of stars to this film, but I settled on 8 because of its high production values and what was, in 1968, an innovative approach to the war film. Remember too that I haven't seen it since 1969. But it did make a strong impression.

The Long Day's Dying must be one of the most vivid antiwar films ever made. It achieves this simply by portraying in extremely realistic terms the actions of a handful of soldiers in Northwestern Europe in 1944-45. No film before this one showed war at the infantry squad level with so much brutal detail, and all in a coldly dispassionate way that lets the actions speak for themselves. There is no preaching, no sentimentality, no comic relief, no complicated scenarios.

Unfortunately, there's no subtlety either. Partly because of their situation - trying to stay alive - the characters come across as flat, familiar cliché's. As "entertainment," the film doesn't make it, though it was clearly not intended to "entertain." It was intended to slug you over the head with the misery and horror of World War II and modern war in general. This was twenty years before Platoon and thirty before Saving Private Ryan, both of which are far more "watchable" films. Here the flat and generally disagreeable characters, the lack of an actual plot, and the realistically unpleasant images (including what may be the first on-screen vomit in theatrical history) make the film hard to sit through, though it is only 95 minutes.

So, 10 stars for production and realism, 4 stars for the feeling you'll have when it's over, a bonus star for having its heart in the right place. Average: 8.

Like Carl Foreman's underrated "The Victors," an equally downbeat but more interesting and thought-provoking film, The Long Day's Dying seems not to be on DVD. Why not? Both films have been on cable a number of times.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":481,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","War"],"datePublished":"1968-05-28","keywords":"shot to death,no survivors,farmhouse,corpse,cult film","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0376101/","name":"David Hemmings","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065777/","name":"Tony Beckley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068552/","name":"Tom Bell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0172772/","name":"Peter Collinson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010407/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0924430/","name":"Alan White","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0939606/","name":"Charles Wood"],"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nonajoler Kabbo
Sól w naszej wodzie
Nonajoler Kabbo
programme.desc: Nonajoler Kabbo: Directed by Rezwan Shahriar Sumit. With Fazlur Rahman Babu, Shatabdi Wadud, Titas Zia, Tasnova Tamanna. When a sculptor visits a remote fishing village on the Bangladeshi Delta, he finds himself center stage in a primal, elemental conflict between land and sea, man and nature, past and future." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6955210/","name":"Nonajoler Kabbo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWEyNjM3NjYtNWI1Ni00NDY0LThhZDEtYjgyOWU0YWEzZTVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4NDY0MDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a sculptor visits a remote fishing village on the Bangladeshi Delta, he finds himself center stage in a primal, elemental conflict between land and sea, man and nature, past and future.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6955210/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MiguelAReina"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"More attractive in form than in substance","reviewBody":"The issue of the confrontation between the traditions of a small fishing village and a newly arrived sculptor is not original, but the film has a beautiful visual proposal, sustained in an excellent cinematography by Chananun Chotrungroj, which takes advantage of natural light and landscape. programme.desc: Bis die Welt einen Rand bekommt: Directed by Daniel Bertram. With Lisa Hagmeister, Günther Harder, Alicia Valencia Pollex. programme.title: Bacurau
Bacurau
programme.desc: Bacurau: Directed by Juliano Dornelles, Kleber Mendonça Filho. With Bárbara Colen, Thomas Aquino, Silvero Pereira, Thardelly Lima. After the death of her grandmother, Teresa comes home to her matriarchal village in a near-future Brazil to find a succession of sinister events that mobilizes all of its residents." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2762506/","name":"Bacurau","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjc1N2M1YjMtYzBiNi00NGFiLThkN2QtY2EwZGU5MDRkODAzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the death of her grandmother, Teresa comes home to her matriarchal village in a near-future Brazil to find a succession of sinister events that mobilizes all of its residents.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2762506/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xstal"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Strange & Curious Proposition...","reviewBody":"One of the strangest films I've seen, in any language, but it must have been good because I'm still processing it a day or two later. The underlying meaning and the intent are not too far off the mark - we're all targeted, hunted and sacrificed by factions that seek to profit from our misfortune, lack of opportunity, demographic, vulnerability and fear; especially when amplified by poverty - if we don't look after ourselves, nobody will. One for all and all for one!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Adventure","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-08-29","keywords":"village,revenge,funeral,drone,murder","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bacurau","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1699659545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjFlNzA2MTktOWM3Zi00YWE1LTgxOWItOTQwYmMxZDRiZDFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjFlNzA2MTktOWM3Zi00YWE1LTgxOWItOTQwYmMxZDRiZDFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8152221/","name":"Bárbara Colen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6203018/","name":"Thomas Aquino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6320498/","name":"Silvero Pereira"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2289860/","name":"Juliano Dornelles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207625/","name":"Kleber Mendonça Filho"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167278/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063732/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581748/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207625/","name":"Kleber Mendonça Filho"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2289860/","name":"Juliano Dornelles"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Run
Asia
programme.desc:
Run: Directed by Aneesh Chaganty. With Sarah Paulson, Kiera Allen, Sara Sohn, Pat Healy. A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8633478/","name":"Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjdmZDlkMzItNTg0OS00MjAxLWE0ZTQtZjdhOWM1MTJkOTc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homeschooled teenager begins to suspect her mother is keeping a dark secret from her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8633478/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Neon_Gold"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Really Fun and Well Made","reviewBody":"This was such a good thriller. I think it was one of the most effective ones that i have seen this year.

It was defiantly a fun, hour and a half popcorn fun movie but i think it was just that little bit extra too. The filmmaking was above that for me. It just had that little bit of extra care put into it and i think it made all the difference.

The acting was really great from both of the leads. I was really impressed with Kiera Allen. This was her debut film and i think this will net her even more roles because she was fantastic.

I found the score really great too. It really worked together with the script and filmmaking to really get you into the film. I appreciated it.

I found the score really great too. It really worked together with the script and filmmaking to really get you into the film. I appreciated it.

Piłat
Pilátus
programme.desc: Pilátus: Directed by Linda Dombrovszky. With Ildikó Hámori, Anna Györgyi, Zsolt Kovács, Sándor Terhes. The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10398080/","name":"Pilátus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTZmMWIyZGYtZDZlZS00YWVkLTlhZjMtNGE4YjM4OWYxZTkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzM3NzY3NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The mother loves her daughter; the daughter loves her mother. The tragedy of misunderstood love. The adaptation of Magda Szabó's novel translated into twelve languages.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10398080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"b_velkova"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A very polite attempt on a primal topic","reviewBody":"The dynamics is very real, but the tone is too formal, even for a doctor's family. Coldness is one thing, but you can't get that distant, no matter the level of dysfunctionality. I remember calling my mother by her last name when I was a teenager, but I never went to her room with the newspaper and asked: "What type of news would you like to hear, mother?" Also, the story is a bit one-sided and doesn't go very deep: behind such clashes usually there are reasons bigger than the mere generational conflict, or a "misunderstood love" as it goes in the description. All in all, a very polite attempt on a primal topic, but for what it is, it's very well executed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-01-29","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405418/","name":"Ildikó Hámori"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350587/","name":"Anna Györgyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468514/","name":"Zsolt Kovács"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2843398/","name":"Linda Dombrovszky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0747074/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4302531/","name":"György Somogyi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0843651/","name":"Magda Szabó"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2703215/","name":"Sándor Szélesi"}]}</script><metacontent="
